body:
Comment 1: 
That's not what it's for.  It's for doing "all".
Things are still fast enough that this is feasible.

Eventually we'd like to have a better build system
not based on make that knew more about go.

Note that there is also run.bash, which doesn't
rebuild the tools, just all the Go code, and is
much faster.

Note that there is also cd $GOROOT/src/pkg; make install
which does even less than run.bash.

There are many options available for doing a little,
but all does everything.
_Owner changed to **r...@golang.org**._ _Status changed to **WontFix**._
